subsections.title: Line of Sight, Multipath, Ducting
subsections.label: subsec:los-multipath
prompts: Explain the concept of multipath propagation and how it affects VHF signal strengths when the antenna is moved slightly.
Describe the impact of vegetation on UHF and microwave signals, focusing on absorption.
Discuss the importance of antenna polarization in long-distance VHF and UHF communications, particularly for CW and SSB contacts.
Explain the consequences of mismatched antenna polarization in VHF and UHF line-of-sight radio links.
Describe how directional antennas can overcome obstructions in VHF/UHF communications by utilizing signal reflection.
Define 'picket fencing' and explain its cause in mobile VHF/UHF communications.
Discuss how precipitation affects the range of microwave frequencies.
Explain the implications of elliptical polarization in ionospheric propagation for antenna selection.
Describe tropospheric ducting and its role in enabling over-the-horizon VHF and UHF communications.
Explain the causes of tropospheric ducting, focusing on temperature inversions in the atmosphere.
